On Wed, Aug 26, 2009 at 4:31 AM, rejohnsoca<regan.v.johnson@...> wrot=
e:
> =C2=A0I want to write a small utility to rename the pictures in a cont=
rollable way, but prefixing something like
> "RND", a set of random digits,=
 and the original name. =C2=A0For example, if the original was
> DCIM1001.j=
pg, I want the class to rename the file to "RND4356332_DCIM1001.jpg".

> I =
want to build this, using TDD.
> but my next question, is now what?

Hi Reg=
an.

In this case I'd personally test and implement from the "outside in".
=
Meaning, I'd actually try and verify the end result we're after.

Conceptua=
lly, I'd write a functional (unit) test that:
 a) In a temporary folder (JU=
nit 4.7's new TemporaryFolder interceptor
is just perfect for this!),
 b) C=
reate a bunch of files named DCIM????.jpg
 c) Run PhotoRandomizer.doYourThi=
ng() on the temporary folder
 d) Verify that all the files in the temporary=
 folder are now named
"RND???????_DCIM????.jpg"

Before I even implement Ph=
otoRandomizer, I can already think of a
couple of 'inner' methods that "can=
 possibly break" such as generating
the random file name from an existing f=
ile, and actually renaming a
single file with a new, random file name.

So =
I'd write tests for those, make them pass, then make the
'outermost' test p=
ass, and before you know it you have a working (or
at least workable) app.
=

My two cents,
- alistair
